content: Synthesis. The synthesis of the metal organic framework Mn3(C8O4H4)3(C5H11ON)2, 1, is a one-pot reaction. A mixture of 0.166 g (1.0 mmol) of benzene 1,4-dicarboxylic acid (H2BDC) and 5 mL of diethylformamide (DEF) was added to 0.287 g (1 mmol) Mn(NO3)2·6H2O dissolved in 2 mL of DEF. This was kept at 102 °C for 3 days. The crystals have the same shape as the monoclinic unit cell and are not resistant to extended exposure in air. Since the diffraction properties of the crystals are not as good as for 2, numerous attempts (>30) were made to grow better quality crystals (variation of time, temperature, concentrations). While our synthesis method is highly reproducible for preparation of 1, we have not been able to grow strongly diffracting crystals for an “ideal” charge density study.
clean_text:
Experimental Section

 Synthesis. The synthesis of the metal organic framework Mn3(C8O4H4)3(C5H11ON)2, 1, is a one-pot reaction. A mixture of 0.166 g (1.0 mmol) of benzene 1,4-dicarboxylic acid (H2BDC) and 5 mL of diethylformamide (DEF) was added to 0.287 g (1 mmol) Mn(NO3)2⋅6H2O dissolved in 2 mL of DEF. This was kept at 102 °C for 3 days. The crystals have the same shape as the monoclinic unit cell and are not resistant to extended exposure in air. Since the diffraction properties of the crystals are not as good as for 2, numerous attempts (>30) were made to grow better quality crystals (variation of time, temperature,  concentrations). While our synthesis method is highly reproducible for preparation of 1, we have not been able to grow strongly diffracting crystals for an "ideal" charge density study.
